personal.name: Louis Follet
personal.title: PhD Student in Quantum Photonics & AI at MIT
bio: I am a PhD student in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at MIT, where I work at the intersection of quantum photonics and artificial intelligence. My research focuses on developing novel photonic systems for quantum computing applications and exploring how machine learning can enhance quantum information processing.

Before joining MIT, I completed my Master's degree in Physics at √âcole Polytechnique, where I developed a strong foundation in quantum mechanics and photonics. My work has been published in top-tier journals and presented at major conferences in the field.

research.title: Quantum Photonic Neural Networks
research.description: Developing novel architectures for quantum neural networks using integrated photonic circuits. This work explores how quantum interference can be harnessed for machine learning tasks with exponential speedup potential.

research.title: Fault-Tolerant Quantum Error Correction
research.description: Investigating photonic approaches to quantum error correction for scalable quantum computing. Our methods show improved error thresholds compared to traditional approaches.

research.title: Machine Learning for Quantum State Tomography
research.description: Using deep learning techniques to reconstruct quantum states from limited measurement data. This work significantly reduces the number of measurements required for accurate state reconstruction.

research.title: Integrated Photonic Quantum Processors
research.description: Designing and fabricating integrated photonic devices for quantum information processing. Our latest prototypes demonstrate high-fidelity quantum gates with improved scalability.

interests.title: Photography
interests.description: I love capturing moments and exploring different perspectives through my camera lens. From urban landscapes to nature scenes, photography helps me see the world differently.

interests.title: Hiking & Outdoor Adventures
interests.description: Exploring nature trails and mountains is my way of recharging. There's something magical about being in the wilderness and disconnecting from technology.

interests.title: Classical Music
interests.description: I play the piano and enjoy attending concerts. Music provides a perfect balance to the analytical work in research, offering emotional and creative expression.

interests.title: Cooking
interests.description: Experimenting with different cuisines and techniques is like conducting experiments in the kitchen. I particularly enjoy French and Asian cooking.

interests.title: Reading
interests.description: From science fiction to philosophy, I believe reading broadly helps develop creativity and critical thinking skills that benefit my research work.

interests.title: Travel
interests.description: Experiencing different cultures and meeting people from around the world has broadened my perspective and inspired new ideas for my research.
